p: We recently reported the in vitro synergistic activity of certain combinations of essential oils with antimicrobials [ 38– 40]. The antimicrobial activity of the M. piperita EO against different Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria and fungi, along with its synergistic effects when combined with antimicrobial drugs (gentamicin, ampicillin, amphotericin B, miconazole and fluconazole), has been studied by following the microdilution checkerboard method. The composition of commercially available M. piperita EO used in our experiments has been confirmed by GC/MS analyses [ 41– 45].
